summary: Email correspondence from Alex Acosta regarding the finalization of a plea agreement for Jeffrey Epstein, including attached proposed documents charging violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 1512 and 113. The email indicates coordination between Acosta and an Assistant U.S. Attorney in West Palm Beach.

persons.name: Alex Acosta
persons.role: U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of Florida
persons.context: Sender of the email discussing finalizing the Epstein plea agreement and indicating he will be out of town.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of the proposed plea agreement and charging documents referenced in the email.

connections.description: Acosta, as U.S. Attorney, is involved in finalizing a plea agreement for Epstein regarding federal charges.

events.title: Email Exchange on Epstein Plea Agreement
events.description: Email correspondence discussing the finalization of a proposed plea agreement and charging documents for Jeffrey Epstein.

locations: 500 S. Australian Ave, Suite 400, West Palm Beach, FL 33401
keyFacts: Alex Acosta, then U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of Florida, was directly involved in finalizing a plea agreement for Jeffrey Epstein in September 2007.
The proposed charges referenced violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 1512 (witness tampering) and 113 (assault within maritime and territorial jurisdiction).
The correspondence indicates coordination between Acosta's office and an Assistant U.S. Attorney in West Palm Beach regarding the plea deal.
The email attachments included both an information charging document and a plea agreement version 4.
The timing shows active negotiation of Epstein's federal plea agreement in mid-September 2007.
